input_text: His policies come at considerable risk as Trump’s often unilateral and unorthodox plans to revolutionize global trade; exert US power over smaller nations; address Iran’s nuclear program; contain China; and halt the killing in Ukraine could backfire.

reformatting.result: Reformatted query: Trump policies global trade US power smaller nations Iran nuclear program China Ukraine conflict

news_query_extraction.result: Trump policies, global trade revolution, US power, Iran nuclear program, China containment, Ukraine conflict

summarization.result:
Here are what other news sources are saying:

1. Wired's Molly Taft discusses how Trump's policies are causing uncertainty for fossil fuel companies by aiming to make fossil fuels so cheap that they wouldn't be worth extracting. This approach challenges the traditional notion of "drill, baby, drill" and raises legal concerns according to experts in the industry. [Read more](https://www.wired.com/story/trumps-policies-are-creating-uncertainty-for-fossil-fuel-companies/)

2. Another Wired article by Dhruv Mehrotra highlights how US Customs and Border Protection has quietly revoked protections for pregnant women and infants, rescinding policies aimed at safeguarding vulnerable individuals in their custody. This move has raised concerns about the treatment of these populations under the current administration. [Read more](https://www.wired.com/story/cbp-rescinds-policies-on-care-of-pregnant-women-infants/)

3. The Verge reports on Apple CEO Tim Cook's statements during an earnings call, revealing that tariffs imposed by President Trump could cost Apple at least $900 million in the current quarter. Cook emphasized the potential impacts of global tariffs on the company's business, shedding light on the challenges posed by trade policies. [Read more](https://www.theverge.com/news/659866/apple-trump-tariffs-cost-tim-cook)

4. Elizabeth Warren's inquiry into Amazon founder Jeff Bezos' relationship with Trump is covered in a piece by The Verge's Emma Roth. Warren questions whether Bezos received any promises or favors from Trump in exchange for his compliance, particularly regarding tariffs. This scrutiny reflects broader concerns about corporate influence on government decisions. [Read more](https://www.theverge.com/news/658829/elizabeth-warren-jeff-bezos-amazon-trump-tariffs)

5. Adi Robertson of The Verge discusses President Trump's pledge to impose a 100 percent tariff on movies "produced in foreign lands," a move that could impact a wide range of films including anime and major Hollywood productions. This decision raises questions about the rationale behind such tariffs and their potential implications for the entertainment industry. [Read more](https://www.theverge.com/politics/660987/trump-tariff-national-security-foreign-films)

Here is some relevant discourse on this and related issues on Reddit:

- A Reddit post titled "Trump has officially put more tariffs on U.S. allies than on China" generated significant discussion, with users pointing out the disparity
